object_information: Being bad at stuff is hard, painful and hard. I've been wanting to start writing for quite some time but there always been another more important (see easier) thing. Well turns out being locked away on long flights is a good fix for making you do stuff.

The first thing was where? Being a techy and not particularly great a front-end stuff I thought I'd build it myself. Reemphasising the point of putting off things I'm not good at, here we are 6 months later. But there's something, despite its humble beginnings. I'll be putting pen to paper and trying to document all of the little things I get up to in and around tech. Plans in the pipeline are building a techified home jungle, tracking things (computer vision) and reflections on that data world.
So here's to being bad at stuff, doing it anyway and improving over time. Rome wasn't built in a day and who am I to think I'm better than the Romans?
